message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the decoding of polar codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The focus is on reducing the complexity of the successive cancellation (SC) decoding algorithm, which is a common decoding algorithm for polar codes. This involves analyzing the structure of the linear binary kernels used in polar codes, which could fall under the category of computational complexity (cs.CC). The paper also proposes a method for reducing the complexity of the SC decoder based on bit-channel transition probabilities, which could be considered a statistical inference problem (cs.SI). The use of recursive formulas and likelihood ratios could also be relevant to the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses simulation results, which could fall under the category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) if the focus is on the performance of polar codes in communication systems.
